intro: Heliotropium torreyi, commonly known as the coastal heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and sandy soils. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Heliotropium torreyi is adapted to tolerate saline conditions and is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
